justification: Assuming the union membership would lead to higher paying job opportunities and better benefits over the course of the applicant's career, the economic impact could be significant. If union membership leads to a $5,000 per year wage premium over 10 years, that would be $50,000 in additional earnings. There may also be improved job security and retirement benefits. However, the lack of formal certifications may limit some of the highest paying opportunities even within the union.
